Sequence Information.Peptide Name: VM-3Y (VM P3Y analog, Leu-rich, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Zhang J, Sun R, Chen Z, Zhou C, Ma C, Zhou M, Chen X, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L.2022
Literature.Title: Evaluation of the Antimicrobial Properties of a Natural Peptide from Vespa mandarinia Venom and Its Synthetic Analogues as a Possible Route to Defeat Drug-Resistant Microbes.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toVCP-VT1 or VML: 38%, G=I: 15%.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus NCTC 6538 or MRSA ATCC 12493 (MIC 2 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E.coli ATCC 8739 (MIC >512 uM), K.pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC >512 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC >512 uM), and yeast C.albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC >512 uM).  Also inhibited biofilms:bacteria:S. aureus (MBIC 2 uM; MBEC 64-128 uM); biofilms:bacteria:E. faecalis (MBIC 64 uM).MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: it permeabilized bacterial membranes (2xMIC, 50%).Structure:  some structure in 10 mM NH4Ac and helical in 50% TFE/NH4Ac.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50 211.2 uM, less hemo.lytic.Animal model:wax moth: survival study: it protected the worms from death in a dose-dependent manner.Resistance development:no:bacteria:S. aureus: no resistance development after 16 cycles of passages. MIC changed 2 fold.
